descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Peja Stojakovic tallied 23 points as the Sacramento Kings won their 19th straight contest at Arco Arena, 99-86, over the slumping San Antonio Spurs in the opener of a four-game homestand.
article.headline: Kings win their 19th straight game at home
article.linkText: Spurs latest victim as Kings win 19th straight at home
article.story:
SACRAMENTO, Calif. (AP) -- Arco Arena is an extremely difficult place to get a road victory. Just ask the San Antonio Spurs, the latest team to have that point hammered home.
Stojakovic

Peja Stojakovic scored 23 points Tuesday night as the Sacramento Kings won easily again at home, using a big second-quarter effort to cruise to a 99-86 victory over the Spurs. The Kings won their 19th straight at Arco Arena and improving to an NBA-best 26-1 at home. "They are playing very well, you have to come in here and respect that," San Antonio reserve guard Antonio Daniels said. "Sometimes we play, sometimes we don't. You have to come in here and play 48 minutes and we didn't do that." Chris Webber had 20 points, 12 rebounds and five blocks for the Kings, who took the lead early in the second quarter and never trailed again. Mike Bibby added 12 points and 10 assists. Scot Pollard added 10 points and 11 rebounds. Despite the victory, Webber was annoyed about a story Tuesday in the Sacramento Bee linking him to supermodel Tyra Banks. Webber said he will not talk to the local media for the remainder of the season. "If you are all going to violate me like that, I know everyone didn't do it, but everyone has to pay for it," said Webber, who used a number of expletives in his brief statement to the media. "I play basketball for you all, I don't live for you all." Tim Duncan had 24 points and 21 rebounds for the Spurs, who have lost three straight to the Kings this season and eight of 11 overall. San Antonio lost its second straight and has dropped five of seven. David Robinson was the only other member of the Spurs in double figures, finishing with 14 points and 10 rebounds. Although it wasn't their typical productive game on offense, the Kings won this game with defense. They forced 18 turnovers and the Spurs shot 39 percent. "I was pleased with the way we approached the game at the defensive end," Kings coach Rick Adelman said. "We really stayed with what we were trying to do." Sacramento ran off nine straight points early in the second quarter when they outscored the Spurs 32-16. Stojakovic scored 13 points in the second period as the Kings took a 52-37 halftime lead. "We knew that the first half was not what we wanted to come out of the break with," Duncan said. "We knew we didn't play anywhere close to decent basketball." San Antonio trailed by 17 points entering the fourth quarter before cutting the lead to 83-73. Bobby Jackson made a 3-pointer and Hedo Turkoglu had two baskets as the Kings went on a 11-2 run, building the lead to 92-73 with 5:09 remaining. Webber got going in the third quarter, scoring 10 points as the Kings built the lead to 20 points late in the period and led 75-58 heading into the fourth. "After having three days off you tend to have a fatigue problem, but late on in the game things were fine," Kings center Vlade Divac said.

Game notes
Duncan had 16 first-half rebounds, but many of them were off his own misses. He shot 5-of-15 in the opening half. ... Sacramento committed just three first-half turnovers. ... San Antonio missed all seven of its 3-pointers.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
